abstract: Federal government and International Brotherhood of Teamsters agree to replace long-established consent decree with settlement that will phase out court supervision of the union following five-year period; decree, which retains election reforms and other changes, was established as part of 1988 settlement following government racketeering case that cited collusion between Teamsters and organized crime.
lead_paragraph: The federal government and the Teamsters union have agreed to replace a consent decree that has governed union affairs for more than a quarter-century with a settlement that would phase out court supervision of its activities, prosecutors said.
snippet: The federal government and the Teamsters union have agreed to replace a consent decree that has governed union affairs for more than a quarter-century with a settlement that would phase out court supervision of its activities, prosecutors said.

headline.main: Under New Agreement, U.S. Will End Oversight of the Teamsters in Five Years
headline.print_headline: U.S. to End Supervision of Teamsters in 5 Years Under a New Agreement
